page.title: 01SYNOPSIS
page.content: { { The area is essentially a farming region concentrating on {Dairy Cattle; {Pasture; Arable crops and market {gardening.}There are 5 farms and 3 of these have farm shops. The whole region is in the London Green Belt and Letchmore Heath, Batlers' Green, Round Bush and Aldenham Village are all in a Conservation area with strict rules governing any developments. Expansion of any built up area is unlikely and unwanted; only infilling will be accepted. The Motorway created a noisy distraction in an otherwise quiet rural setting, to the west; but the community has learned to live with it, even though the original 4 lanes have been changed to 6 thus reducing still further the green pastures.
